CONTENTS.P: Procurement reference: 9022-IFT- 46147
Project name: Khorog Solid Waste II project
Country: Republic of Tajikistan
Business sector: MEI
Project ID: 46147
Funding source: EBRD and SECO
Type of contract: Goods and Related Services
Type of notice: Invitation for tenders
Issue date: 9.3.2018
Closing date: 7.5.2018, 14:00 local time
This Invitation for tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published on the EBRD website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 8707-GPN-46147 issued on 30.5.2017.

State Subsidiary Unitary Enterprise (SSUE) Khojagii Manziliyu Kommunali of Khorog City», hereinafter referred to as “the Purchaser”, intends using part of the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) and Swiss State Secretariat for Economic Affairs (SECO) towards the cost of the Sub-project solid-waste management of Khorog city.
The purchaser now invites sealed tenders from suppliers for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan and the grant:
KhoSWSP 002 Procurement of waste collection and transportation trucks:
— Lot no 1. Side loading waste collection truck with body capacity not less than 8 m³,
— Lot no 2. Rare loading waste truck with body capacity not less than 16 m³,
— Lot no 3. Small size rare loading waste truck with body capacity not less than 5m³,
— Lot no 4. Minibus with not less than 13 seats,
— Lot no 5. Small size truck (pickup) 4x4 carrying capacity not less than 1 000 kg.
The lots will be implemented concurrently and should be completed within 4 months.
Tenders are invited for one or more lots. Each lot must be priced separately. Tenders for more than one lot may offer discounts and such discounts will be considered in the comparison of tenders.
Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank and of a grant is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:
— The tenderer shall have an average annual turnover calculated as total certified payments received for contracts in progress or completed, within 2015-2017 years in amount of:
—— Lot no 1 - 975 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 2 - 400 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 3 - 325 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 4 - 110 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 5 - 135 000 USD equivalent,

— The tenderer must demonstrate access to, or availability of, financial resources such as liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means, other than any contractual advance payments to meet:
(i) the following cash-flow requirement:
— Lot no 1 – 170 000 USD equivalent,
— Lot no 2 – 70 000 USD equivalent,
— Lot no 3 – 60 000 USD equivalent,
— Lot no 4 – 20 000 USD equivalent,
— Lot no 5 – 25 000 USD equivalent.
(ii) the overall cash flow requirements for this contract and its current commitments.

— Experience as supplier, in at least 2 (two) contracts that have been successfully and substantially completed and that are similar to the proposed goods within 2013-2017 years, each with a value of at least:
—— Lot no 1 – 170 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 2 – 70 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 3 – 60 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 4 – 20 000 USD equivalent,
—— Lot no 5 – 25 000 USD equivalent,
— Joint ventures, consortiums or associations (JVCA) shall meet the following minimum qualification requirements:
—— The Lead Partner shall demonstrate at least 1 contact per lot successfully executed,
—— All partners shall be jointly and severally liable,

—— JVCA representative shall have the original of power of attorney as authority to conduct all business for and on behalf of any and all the partners of the joint venture/consortium during tender process and, in the event of the contract, during contract execution.

Tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a nonrefundable fee of 100 USD in dollars or in Tajik Somoni according to the exchange rate of National Bank of Tajikistan at the payment date to the following bank account:
Dollar account:
BENEFICIARY: SSUE "Khojagii Manziliyu Kommunali"
BENEFICIARY ACCOUNT: 20202972300005567000
BANK OF BENEFICIARY: Amonatbank branch #67 in Khorog city
CORR. ACCOUNT № 20402972316264
Tajik Somoni account:
“Amonatbank branch #67 in Khorog city”
Bank identification code: 350101626
Taxpayer identification number: 700000802
Correspondent account: 20402972316264

Upon receipt of appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee, the documents will promptly be dispatched by courier; however, no liability can be accepted for their loss or late delivery. In addition, if requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically after presentation by the prospective tenderer of an appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee. In the event of discrepancy between electronic and hard copies of the documents, the hard copy shall prevail.
All tenders must be accompanied by a tender security of:
— Lot no 1: 4 500 (Four thousand five hundred) USD,
— Lot no 2: 2 000 (Two thousand) USD,
— Lot no 3: 1 500 (One thousand five hundred) USD,
— Lot no 4: 500 (Five hundred) USD,
— Lot no 5: 1 000 (One thousand) USD.
Or its equivalent in Tajik Somoni according to the exchange rate of National Bank of Tajikistan at the date of such tender security issuance.

Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 14:00 (local time), 7.5.2018 at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend:
State Committee on Investment and State Property Management of the Republic of Tajikistan,
Shotemur street 27, Dushanbe, Republic of Tajikistan, postal code: 734025
The applicable procurement rules are the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at: http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
A register of potential tenderers who have purchased the tender documents may be inspected at the address below.
Prospective tenderers may obtain further information from, and inspect and acquire the tender documents at, the following office:
